means: 剥夺…的选举权，剥夺…的公民权，终止…的特许权( disenfranchise的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: A disenfranchised person cannot vote or hold office.
sentence.Network_cn: 被剥夺公民权的人不能投票也不能任公职.

sentence.Network_en: Woeser has become an accidental hero to a generation of disenfranchised young Tibetans.
sentence.Network_cn: 她已经意外地成为一整个世代声音被夺走的藏人的英雄.

sentence.Network_en: Oddly, though, the shareholders in American companies are like the disenfranchised citizens of a rotten borough.
sentence.Network_cn: 然而奇怪的是, 美国公司的众股东却像是有名无实选区里被剥夺了投票权的居民.

list.abs: 16. EU Directive欧盟指令17. political disenfranchisement 剥夺政治权利
被剥夺的悲伤（disenfranchised grief）—家中有罹患忧郁症、精神分裂…等精神疾病的家属，尤其是父母亲，必须长期面对挫折与痛 …
5.被剥夺权利的悲伤(disenfranchised grief)：指个人在某个失落后，经验到的悲伤是无法或不能公开被承认、公开哀悼或获得社会支持。
protecting the disenfranchised corporations that have been abandoned by their very own consumers - ., 维护那些被他们自己消费者所抛弃的剥削企业.
A disenfranchised person cannot vote or hold office ., 被剥夺公民权的人不能投票也不能任公职.

entry.def: To disenfranchise a group of people means to take away their right to vote, or their right to vote for what they really want.

example.ex: ...fears of an organized attempt to disenfranchise supporters of Father Aristide.
example.tran: 对剥夺阿里斯蒂德神父支持者选举权这一有组织企图的担心
被剥夺了选举权的少数民族的无助

means.word_mean: 1. deprived of the rights of citizenship especially the right to vote

auth_sentence.content: Henshaw sued, arguing that he had been disenfranchised.
auth_sentence.res_content: Henshaw sued, arguing that he had been disenfranchised.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Henshaw sued, arguing that he had been disenfranchised.

auth_sentence.content: He worked to extend the vote to disenfranchised blacks.
auth_sentence.res_content: He worked to extend the vote to disenfranchised blacks.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He worked to extend the vote to disenfranchised blacks.

auth_sentence.content: The rest of the country is completely disenfranchised.
auth_sentence.res_content: The rest of the country is completely disenfranchised.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The rest of the country is completely disenfranchised.
